heisig_chinese_memo: Rough seas are a body of water that is most difficult to travel over. But at the end, you arrive at the comfort of a beach.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: difficult (難) water (氵) = open sea
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Water at the beach is definitely more difficult to swim in than water in a pool.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " water " to " difficult " sound. "Shuowen" uses " 𤅩 " as the orthographic character and " tan " as the vulgar character. In ancient characters, " bird " and "隹" are synonymous symbols. " Tan " is pronounced as " Han " in bronze inscriptions, which means Hanshui, so Chen Weizhan believed that " Han " and " Tan " were used in ancient Chinese. The word " Han " in "Shuowen" also goes: "From the water, it is difficult to save the sound." See " Han ".

" Beach " means a place where the water is shallow and rocky and the current is very rapid. Such as "Water Classic Note. "River Water": "Although the mountains are open, the turbulent flow is still stubborn, rocks, clouds, and waves overflow. There are 19 beaches together. The current is swift and the same as the Three Gorges. The damage to the boats and boats has been inflicted since ancient times." . Volume 3": "In December of the first year of Yongjian, the county magistrate Zhao Zhi sent the officials to Xianni and Bashu Shou to pass into Ruitan and die."

After the " beach ", it often refers to the flat land formed by sedimentation on the banks of the river. For example, Wang Wei of the Tang Dynasty's "Baishitan": "The clear white rocky beach, and the green grasses look good." "Journey to the West" Chapter 44: "During the discussion, I saw a beach open space outside the city gate, crowded with many monks. , Pull the car there."
humanum_short_description_en: From " water " to " difficult " sound. " Tan " is pronounced as " Han " in bronze inscriptions, which means Hanshui, so Chen Weizhan believed that " Han " and " Tan " were used in ancient Chinese.
humanum_full_description:
從「水」，「難」聲。《說文》以「𤅩」為正字，「灘」為俗字。古文字中「鳥」和「隹」為義近形符。金文「灘」字讀作「漢」，表示漢水，故陳煒湛認為「漢」、「灘」古本一字。《說文》「漢」字下亦云：「从水，難省聲。」參見「漢」。

　　「灘」表示水淺多石而且水流很急的地方。如《水經注．河水》：「其山雖闢，尚梗湍流，激石雲洄，澴波怒溢，合有十九灘，水流迅急，勢同三峽，破害舟船，自古所患。」《華陽國志．卷三》：「永建元年十二月，縣長趙祉遣吏先尼和拜檄巴蜀守，過成瑞灘，死。」

　　「灘」後多表示江河邊上泥沙淤積成的平地。如唐代王維〈白石灘〉：「清淺白石灘，綠蒲向堪把。」《西遊記》第44回：「正議間，只見那城門外，有一塊沙灘空地，攢簇了許多和尚，在那裏扯車兒哩。」
humanum_short_description: 從「水」，「難」聲。金文「灘」字讀作「漢」，表示漢水，故陳煒湛認為「漢」、「灘」古本一字。

從「 水 」，「 難 」聲。《說文》以「 𤅩 」為正字，「 灘 」為俗字。古文字中「 鳥 」和「 隹 」為義近形符。金文「 灘 」字讀作「 漢 」，表示漢水，故陳煒湛認為「 漢 」、「 灘 」古本一字。《說文》「 漢 」字下亦云：「从水，難省聲。」參見「 漢 」。 「 灘 」表示水淺多石而且水流很急的地方。如《水經注．河水》：「其山雖闢，尚梗湍流，激石雲洄，澴波怒溢，合有十九灘，水流迅急，勢同三峽，破害舟船，自古所患。」《華陽國志．卷三》：「永建元年十二月，縣長趙祉遣吏先尼和拜檄巴蜀守，過成瑞灘，死。」 「 灘 」後多表示江河邊上泥沙淤積成的平地。如唐代王維〈白石灘〉：「清淺白石灘，綠蒲向堪把。」《西遊記》第44回：「正議間，只見那城門外，有一塊沙灘空地，攢簇了許多和尚，在那裏扯車兒哩。」
From " water" to " difficult" sound. "Shuowen" uses " 𤅩" as the orthographic character and " tan" as the vulgar character. In ancient characters, " bird" and " 隹" are synonymous symbols. " Tan" is pronounced as " Han" in bronze inscriptions, which means Hanshui, so Chen Weizhan believed that " Han" and " Tan" were used in ancient Chinese. The word " Han" in "Shuowen" also goes: "From the water, it is difficult to save the sound." See " Han". " Beach" means a place where the water is shallow and rocky and the current is very rapid. Such as "Water Classic Note. "River Water": "Although the mountains are open, the turbulent flow is still stubborn, rocks, clouds, and waves overflow. There are 19 beaches together. The current is swift and the same as the Three Gorges. The damage to the boats and boats has been inflicted since ancient times." . Volume 3": "In December of the first year of Yongjian, the county magistrate Zhao Zhi sent the officials to Xianni and Bashu Shou to pass into Ruitan and die." After the " beach", it often refers to the flat land formed by sedimentation on the banks of the river. For example, Wang Wei of the Tang Dynasty's "Baishitan": "The clear white rocky beach, and the green grasses look good." "Journey to the West" Chapter 44: "During the discussion, I saw a beach open space outside the city gate, crowded with many monks. , Pull the car there."

灘字的基本解释

灘
tān
见“滩”。

灘字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tān］
［《廣韻》他干切，平寒，透。］
“滩1”的繁体字。
(1)江河中水浅多沙石而流急之处。
(2)滩头。指江、河、湖、海边水涨淹没、水退显露的淤积平地。
(3)量词。用于在平面上成滩的东西。
(4)气力尽。
(5)等级。

灘字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　灘； 康熙笔画：23； 页码：页663第22
〔古文〕潬【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】他干切【正韻】他丹切，?育攤。水灘也。【增韻】瀨也。　又【集韻】他含切，音貪。【爾雅·釋天】太歲在申曰涒灘。　又【集韻】【韻會】?他案切，音炭。義同。　又【廣韻】呼旱切【集韻】許旱切，?音䍐。水濡而乾也。與暵同。【說文】作?。　又【廣韻】奴案切【集韻】乃案切，?難去聲。水奔流貌。　又【韻補】叶他涓切，音湍。【白居易詩】手拄靑竹杖，足踏白石灘。漸怪耳目曠，不聞人世喧。

灘字的源字形

字源演变：

金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

灘字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［tān］
["Guangyun" he cuts dry, calms down, and thoroughly. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "Beach 1".
(1) The water in the river is shallow, sandy and rapid.
(2) Beachhead. Refers to the siltated flat land where the rivers, rivers, lakes, and seasides are rising and submerging, and the water is retreating.
(3) Quantifiers. Used for things that form a beach on a flat surface.
(4) Exhausted.
(5) Level.
